statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: S. Utah 76, Valparaiso 60
article.story: CEDAR CITY, Utah (AP) -- Orlando Griego scored a career-high 19 points and grabbed a game-high seven rebounds, leading Southern Utah to a 76-60 win over Valparaiso on Saturday night. Steve Barnes and Swaney Cooper scored 13 points each, and Barnes added nine assists for the Thunderbirds (14-8, 4-3 Mid-Continent), who shot 55 percent and outrebounded the Crusaders 20-12 in the second half. Brandon McPherson scored 17 points to lead Valparaiso (10-11, 4-3), which entered the game having won four straight but shot 33 percent and committed nine turnovers in the first half. Samuel Haanpaa scored 13 points, all in the second half, for the Crusaders, and Shawn Huff added 12. The win was Southern Utah's fourth in its last five games; the Thunderbirds are 10-1 at home this season. Griego and Barnes keyed an 11-0 run midway through the first half that gave Southern Utah its first double-digit lead. Barnes' coast-to-coast layup broke a 13-13 tie at 9:24, and Griego followed with a fast-break layup and a three-point play. After Barnes sank a jumper from left of the key, he assisted Brad Kanis to a layup with 5:19 left in the first half, giving Southern Utah a 24-13 lead. Kanis' dunk seven minutes into the second half gave the Thunderbirds their biggest lead, 42-26. McPherson hit consecutive 3-pointers to spark a Valparaiso rally, and the Crusaders cut the lead to six points, 62-56, on Huff's two free throws with 2:54 left. Southern Utah went 9-for-10 from the foul line in the final two minutes.
